page.title: 05Brickhouse Farm,Congleton
page.content: Brickhouse Farm is situated two kilometres north of{Congleton.} It covers an area of 175 acres, 65 of which are used for growing potatoes, and the rest is used for peas, barley and grazing. They have 275 ewes and 400 lambs, including some store sheep. Traditionally,{Cheshire}is a dairy county, but now fewer than half of the farms are dairy farms. In addition, the number of farms is decreasing, as the size of each farm increases. Crops are grown in a five year rotation. There are two types of barley, "Spring barley" and "Winter barley." The peas are used to feed the animals. The wool goes to 'North England Wools', and is used to make clothing and carpets. Sheep, cattle and pigs are used for meat and breeding purposes.
